title: Optimal Referral Auction Design. (arXiv:2208.09326v2 [cs.GT] UPDATED)
abstract: The auction of a single indivisible item is one of the most celebrated problems in mechanism design with transfers. Despite its simplicity, it provides arguably the cleanest and most insightful results in the literature. When the information that the auction is running is available to every participant, Myerson [20] provided a seminal result to characterize the incentive-compatible auctions along with revenue optimality. However, such a result does not hold in an auction on a network, where the information of the auction is spread via the agents, and they need incentives to forward the information. In recent times, a few auctions (e.g., [13, 18]) were designed that appropriately incentivized the intermediate nodes on the network to promulgate the information to potentially more valuable bidders. In this paper, we provide a Myerson-like characterization of incentive-compatible auctions on a network and show that the currently known auctions fall within this class of randomized auctions.

translated_abstract: 单件不可分割物品的拍卖是机制设计中最广泛讨论的问题之一。尽管其简单性，但它提供了文献中可能是最干净和最有洞察力的结果。当每个参与者都知道拍卖正在进行时，Myerson [20]提供了一个具有创造性的结果，以确定激励相容的拍卖和最大收入。然而，在网络上的拍卖中，这样的结果并不成立，因为拍卖的信息是通过代理传播的，他们需要激励来传递信息。最近，一些拍卖（例如[13, 18]）被设计成适当激励网络上的中间节点来传播信息给更有价值的竞标者。在本文中，我们提供了一个类似于Myerson的激励相容拍卖的特征，并且表明当前已知的拍卖属于这类随机拍卖的范畴。
tldr: 该论文介绍了一个关于在网络上进行的推荐拍卖的最优设计，通过提供一个类似于Myerson的激励相容拍卖的特征。研究者证明了当前已知的拍卖都属于这类随机拍卖的范畴。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces an optimal design for referral auctions conducted on a network, providing a Myerson-like characterization of incentive-compatible auctions. The researchers demonstrate that the currently known auctions fall within this class of randomized auctions.
